thread.title: Chelsea star Thibaut Courtois and Manchester United midfielder Marouane Fellaini to miss Russia vs Belgium clash
thread.title_full: Chelsea star Thibaut Courtois and Manchester United midfielder Marouane Fellaini to miss Russia vs Belgium clash

author: dfraser
title: Chelsea star Thibaut Courtois and Manchester United midfielder Marouane Fellaini to miss Russia vs Belgium clash

organizations.name: manchester united getty images kevin de bruyne

text:
Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments CHELSEA star Thibaut Courtois and Manchester United midfielder Marouane Fellaini have been ruled out of Belgium’s friendly clash with Russia. 
The Premier League duo will miss the game with a hip and toe injury respectively, having both featured in the 1-1 draw against Greece on Saturday in their World Cup qualifier. Getty Images 4 Thibaut Courtois has been ruled out of Belgium’s game with Russia through injury 
Courtois and Fellaini join fellow top flight stars Eden Hazard and Kevin De Bruyne on the sidelines for Roberto Martinez’s Red Devils. 
Keep up to date with ALL the Chelsea and Manchester United news, gossip, transfers and goals on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary. 
Blues forward Hazard was ruled out last week with a calf problem, while the Manchester City maestro is still recovering from a groin injury. 
All four are now major doubts for their Premier League outings at the weekend. Hazard, Kante and Courtois put skills to the test in real-life FIFA 17 challenge Reuters 4 Marouane Fellaini has been ruled out for Belgium with a knock 
Chelsea pair Courtois and Hazard may miss the league-leaders' clash with Crystal Palace on Saturday, while De Bruyne could be out of the massive game with Arsenal. 
Meanwhile, Fellaini may not recover in time for United's game against West Brom at Old Trafford. 
Belgium will be disappointed with their draw last time out, having relied on a late Romelu Lukaku equaliser, with the Greeks down to ten-men for the final half and hour. Marouane Fellaini concedes late penalty on 100th appearance for Manchester United Getty Images Kevin De Bruyne is another Belgian to sit on the sidelines Getty Images Eden Hazard is also on the ever-growing Belgium injury list 
Greece left the pitch with just nine men after Gerogios Tzavellas was also sent-off in the 95th-minute. 
However, Belgium remain top of Group H with 13 points from their five games, ahead of Greece on 11 and Bosnia and Herzegovina on ten. 
European minnow Cyprus, Estonia and Gibraltar complete the group.
